EXTRACTED VALUE: Even though it has open-ended free roaming aspects, it feels far more like a short linear game supplemented by hidden areas and bonus missions.
Prince of Persia Classic is a fine example of how to modernize an older game while keeping its appeal intact.
Next-gen football with great graphics that seem to have come at the expense of gameplay options found in current-gen versions of the game.
Catan translates surprisingly well to the Live Arcade, and this is mainly because of its smart design choices and addictive multiplayer offerings.
It looks good, it plays well, it’s easy to pick up and the Street fighter theme compliments the puzzling gameplay.
By any measure, it has solid racing mechanics. But then, variety is the spice of life and this title could use a bit more.
A solid game, and its Stunt Mode alone can be played for endless hours without a trace of boredom seeping in.
Online issues aside, EA has never released such a feature rich and incredibly polished college football game.
The player likenesses are fantastic and the overall presentation is wonderful.
Graphically, TS2 doesn’t look a heck of a lot prettier than it did on its Xbox debut.
Throw in more responsive skating and a brilliant new face-off system, and we definitely dig how NHL 2K8 shakes and bakes. [Nov 2007, p.92]
Superbly fun single player with a largely forgettable multiplayer tagged on.
The realistic look is one we like. You just want to keep on playing.
For me, it doesn’t get much better than this. Sure, it is a port, but a damn good one that will keep me busy for quite some time.
With lots of options, vibrant presentation, and well-implemented online play, Uno is a pleasant five-dollar diversion.
Mercenaries 2 is a lot of fun if you don't get bogged down by its rough-hewn minutiae and relish the simple pleasures of blowing things up.
Proving Ground isn't the best Tony Hawk title, but it sure is nice to have him come back, hang out and remind us all just how cool he used to be.
